oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A QUASI-3D MODEL FOR SUSPENDED SEDIMENT TRANSPORT BY CURRENTS AND WAVES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Katopodi, Irene
Ribberink, Jan S.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: suspended sediment
sediment transport
quasi-3D model
current model
wave model
transport model
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A QUASI-3D model for suspended sediment transport based on an asymptotic solution of the convection-diffusion equation is developed for currents and waves. The influence of waves on the sediment concentration is included through the diffusion analogy and the bed boundary condition. Validity analysis provides conditions that permit the check of the model applicability. The presence of waves enhances the validity area of the model considerably. The model compares favourably with a 3D model and experimental data.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 22 (1990): Proceedings of 22nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Delft, The Netherlands, 1990.
